quote: There are people who are never content, never appeased, forever dissatisfied—who continually look to what escapes them, convincing themselves that if only they could attain that one desire outside of reach they would be happy.  It seems almost pointless to give to these people because their eyes immediately shift from the gift to stare miserably at the portion held back.  Their wants, demands, expectations, appetites are never satiated, thus they refuse to be happy.  And you cannot make them so.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: disappointment, greed, misery, richelle, richelle-goodrich, unappeasable, unhappy

quote: What's the point of changing who you are in order to impress a woman, when your intention is to return to who you were, a person she was never attracted to in the first place?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: attraction, dating, love, men-and-women, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: What were good and evil, really, but stupid categories? Stupid categoriesthat restricted people and punished or rewarded them based on how they responded to their own natures, natures they really didn't have any way to control.
author: Richelle Mead, Succubus Blues
category: blues, georgina, kincaid, mead, richelle, succubus

quote: Punishing a person for the wrongs of another makes about as much sense as throwing up to enjoy the meal a second time.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: cruelty, punishment, richelle, richelle-goodrich, unkindness, wrongs

quote: Vengeance, retaliation, retribution, revenge are deceitful brothers—vile, beguiling demons promising justifiable compensation to a pained soul for his losses. Yet in truth they craftily fester away all else of worth remaining.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse
category: beguiling, compensation, deceit, destruction, retaliation, retribution, revenge, richelle, richelle-goodrich, vengeance

quote: Your opponent's wrong doesn't automatically make you right. Most fights aren't about who's right
author: they are contention over degrees of wrongness.

quote: I hate it when storm clouds roll in, heralded by dazzling claps of thunder and lightning that boast an ocean of tears. This majestic performance of bad temper manages to overshadow my pathetic attempts at pouting. No one broods like Mother Nature, hence she steals all the attention I was sulking after.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: brooding, lightning, mother-nature, pouting, rain, richelle, richelle-goodrich, storms, sulking, thunder

quote: Vengeance is a monster of appetite, forever bloodthirsty and never filled.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse
category: getting-even, retaliation, retribution, revenge, richelle, richelle-goodrich, vengeance

quote: When you begin to care too much about what everyone else says, your confidence shrinks and you start to feel like insignificant, little Jack in a strange land of intimidating giants. But when you come to realize that opinions are as diverse and plentiful as dried beans, you might reach the conclusion that your own is of the greatest worth. That's when your confidence grows, and soon you find yourself striding like Gandalf the wondrous wizard among common hobbits in the shire. Respecting your own opinion is the magic that transforms both you and your world.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway

quote: It's okay to be absurd, ridiculous, and downright irrational at times; silliness is sweet syrup that helps us swallow the bitter pills of life.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: bitter-pills, coping, life, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, silliness, silly

quote: Easter
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: easter, easter-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, spring, springtime

quote: The description of Huck’s father grabbed my full attention, and I glanced up at the book in my teacher’s hand as if to double check. My eyes bulged reflexively. Huck’s father was an abusive drunk just like mine. The boy was hopeful that a corpse found near the river was actually his dad, but it turned out not to be. It was spooky how high my hopes rose for the boy, and then sank so utterly low when the body was discovered to be a female in disguise. I should’ve mourned for the woman, but it was the boy I felt bad for.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Dandelions: The Disappearance of Annabelle Fancher

quote: Smile wide to receive many smiles in return. But if you want a good laugh, smirk like a wicked, little imp and watch the range of expressions you're flashed.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: expressions, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, smile, smirk

quote: It isn’t always true that a critical end justifies desperate means.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse
category: halloween, means-and-ends, means-justifying-the-ends, revenge, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-tarishe-curse

quote: I squinted at the western sky behind Thaddeus, a blood-red smear melting into blackness. Twisting my neck, I glanced the opposite direction. My teeth clenched at a magnified, round moon nearly as scarlet as the portending sunset, its luminous face half masked by hazy cloud cover. Hatred, vengeance, anger……such emotions coursed through my veins in a poisonous concoction that muddied my mind, impelling me to grip my sword tighter and fight with every ounce of strength I possessed against those who threatened my family - my kind. Currently, Thaddeus was behaving as such a threat, using his powers of persuasion to condone human sacrifice for some outrageously perceived good. He wanted an offering for the monsters; a desperate, futile offering of human flesh that would in no way protect the other villagers from being mauled as he promised.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse

quote: Gavin stood within the trees, observing her from the shadows. He watched the basket rise to her nose as she closed her eyes to sniff at its contents. A smile told him it smelled delicious, but she didn’t open the container to pinch off a sample. Instead, the basket lowered to swing at her side as it had previously done.	All at once the air was filled with soft singing--a sweet, merry tune comprised of ludicrous lyrics. It was impossible not to grin at the
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Secrets of a Noble Key Keeper
category: annabelle, dreamland, dreams, gavin, richelle, richelle-goodrich, secrets-of-a-noble-key-keeper, singing

quote: And so the game went on in this manner, a throng of children playing keep-away from a bowling ball tossed back and forth between two plump ogres. The air filled with shrieks and cheers and shouts of laughter as daring players thrilled at the sport. That is, all but the few poor souls knocked flat and captured. No laughter rose from behind bars because those in the birdcage knew what was in store. They would soon be lunch for a couple of hungry ogres. 	Now you might be thinking—didn’t Gavin call it fun when he was swallowed by a wolf earlier? And didn’t he tell that raven-haired girl it doesn’t hurt to be swallowed whole by a bear? All true, all true. But here’s a secret you might not
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Secrets of a Noble Key Keeper
category: dreamland, dreams, games, gavin, ogres, playing, richelle, richelle-goodrich, secrets

quote: Never judge another knight without first knowing the strength and cunning of the dragons he fights.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: dragons, good-judgment, judge, judging, judging-others, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, slaying-dragons

quote: I let my sword slip to the ground, and for the second time I stood unarmed in the presence of werewolves.Kresh put his lips to my forehead, and my skin burned beneath his kiss. When his hands repositioned to take me by the waist, my breathing—already shallow—ceased entirely. Then his lips fell on mine and I was suddenly everything he claimed me to be—his mate, his wife, his world.The taste of him seemed mysteriously new and old at the same time. Every bit of tension eased as if internally I had come home again, and yet a sense of foreignness made our connection a sweet venture. My breast was afire as he continued to grasp my hips, keeping me close. I burned for him as if vampire venom were coursing through every inch of me. The man was a constellation of suns in my desire, unlike Thaddeus who hardly equaled a speck of stardust. The thought of that coward reminded me of grim news. It took every bit of willpower I possessed to tear my lips away from what they craved, and yet I remained a submissive puddle in this werewolf’s arms.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse
category: duvalla, hallows-eve, kresh, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, tarishe-curse, vampires, werewolf-romance, werewolves, witches

quote: Derian pulled the blanket snug around himself. “This is my added assurance.” Eena’s nose wrinkled. “It’s your what?” “If you recall the last time we were here standing in this very spot, you pelted me with neumberries.” He held up a single berry before popping it into his mouth. “I doubt you would risk soiling your blanket, so I figure wrapping it around me this way I’m pretty much assured safety from any potential attack.” He winked playfully, and she laughed out loud. “I’m afraid you don’t know me half as well as you think,” she announced. Aiming low, she flung a sizable berry at his calve. It hit its mark.“Whoa, whoa!” He lowered the blanket to cover his legs. “You can’t hide yourself entirely, Derian,” she said, aiming for his face. He ducked, raising the blanket like a shield in the process.Another round of ammunition pelted his ankles before he decided it was time to fight back. Eena found herself bound up in her own blanket, arms wrapped securely at her sides. She laughed nonstop, unable to move within his strong hold. Derian leaned forward until their noses touched, and then he kissed her giggles silent. He kept her in the blanket, snug and close to him, but Eena managed to wriggle an arm free and drape it around his neck, holding his lips in reach. She uttered a quick count in between kisses.“Seven,” she breathed.Derian paused, his mouth a whisper away from hers. It tickled when he spoke. “No, no, Eena.”“No what?”“No counting. Not today. No ground rules.”She barely uttered a partial “’kay” before his mouth covered hers again. His hot breath tasted like breakfast. He fixed his hands on each side of her face, and the blanket fell to the ground. As the intensity of their kisses grew hungry, he gripped her cheeks more securely. Eena could feel the air electrifying around them. Her heartbeat drummed—excited and anxious. “Derian…” she breathed. But he didn’t stop. She felt his hand move to support her neck while the other slid down her back, urging her closer. She brought her arms together and pressed against his chest, somewhat objecting to the intimacy.“Derian…” she tried again. But he covered her mouth with his own.She pushed more firmly against him without success. Her protest weakened as his kisses softened. The fervor subsided, and she could feel her wild pulse even out. Amidst a string of supple kisses, Derian’s breathing slowed. He planted his lips on her forehead for a moment before squeezing her tenderly. She snuggled up against his warm chest. “One ground rule,” he whispered in her ear. “We stop when you say ‘when.’”“When,” she uttered.“Okay,” he agreed.Then, as if the thought had just occurred to her, she stepped back to look up questioningly at the captain. “Wasn’t there a leftover sandwich in that basket from last night?”His lips formed a guilty smile as he confessed, “Yes—and it was delicious.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Two Sisters
category: adventure-books, derian, eena, epic-saga, fantasy-books, harrowbethian-saga, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, romance, romance-books, sagas, scifi-books, series

quote: Turn around….you’ve got grass and dead flowers…”My fingers naturally began to comb through my long, black strands, shaking things loose as Sarti carefully removed more stubborn pieces. The flowers had been left over from my forced marriage to Thaddeus. The grass, from a sensual night with Kresh the eve of my honeymoon. Devilish irony.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse
category: hallows-eve, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-tarishe-curse, werewolf, werewolf-romance, werewolves

quote: Kresh kept silent beside me as Baron rehearsed his deadly plan. I listened with my eyes aimed at the horizon, witnessing the night consume a final red vein of daylight. It struck me that nightfall always drowned the sunset. Never did the sun resurface from where it sank, nor would it ever.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse
category: duvalla, gargoyles, hallows-eve, kresh, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-tarishe-curse, vampires, werewolf, werewolves, witches

quote: Annoyances are strangely not so annoying when the person responsible has endeared himself to you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: annoyances, annoying, annoying-people, endearing, endearment, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: What are you most thankful for?” she asked.My reply came easily. “Being too blessed to have any hope of answering that question.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: being-blessed, blessings, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, thankful, thankfulness, thanks, thanksgiving

quote: Some birthdays make you happy.Some birthdays bring you down.Some birthdays make you jump for joyWhile others paint a frown.Regardless of your feelingsOr if you’re far or near,The earth was blessed this special dayWhen Heaven placed you here.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: birthday-quotes, birthdays, happy-birthday, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, special-day

quote: Life’s journey doesn’t start on the highest mountain peak where a clear view of the trail ahead, obstacles and all, is laid out for us to observe before setting foot on the path. No. Life’s journey begins on a low road, in a valley, or even down inside a pit where the trail beyond can only be seen in short stretches, and any obstacles are met as they come. This makes life trying, even scary at times. Have faith that God gave you this life, and hence it is worth seeing through to the end of the trail.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: endure, endure-to-the-end, hardships, journey-through-life, life, life-s-journey, never-give-up, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, trials

quote: Thank you for the day and night,for rainy spells and summer’s light.Thank you for the skies of blueand puffy clouds in grayish hue.Thank you for the gigglefestsand midnight’s cloak to hasten rest.Thank you for tomorrow newand yesterday’s tomorrow too.Thank you for “I’m glad we met”and also for “we haven’t yet.”Thank you for the peace of mind a grateful soul doth always find.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-grateful, be-thankful, gratefulness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, thank-you, thankfulness, thanks

quote: Every birthday celebrates a life because every life is important.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: birthday, birthday-quotes, birthdays, celebrating-your-birthday, every-life-is-important, happy-birthday, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Maybe Christmas is more than a day to receive. Maybe Christmas, perhaps, is a day to believe.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: a-day-to-believe, christmas, christmas-is, christmas-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The jack-o-lantern follows me with tapered, glowing eyes.His yellow teeth grin evily. His cackle I despise.But I shall have the final laugh when Halloween is through.This pumpkin king I’ll split in half to make a pie for two.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: halloween, halloween-quotes, jack-o-lantern, pumpkin, pumpkin-king, pumpkins, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: For every one person who praises you, there are a hundred who would criticize. Heed neither the one nor the hundred. It is your own opinion that truly matters.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-true-to-yourself, criticism, heed-your-own-advice, opinions, praise, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, your-own-opinion

quote: The hero isn’t the one who is right, but the one who steps forward to take the blame—deserved or not—and apologize to save a relationship.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: apologize, apology, hero, heroes, i-m-sorry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Just say “I’m sorry.” It’s not a tongue twister. It does not need repeating multiple times. The phrase is simple and short, easy to articulate. And the last time I checked, it sounded just as good—if not better—in a whisper. So just say it; say “I’m sorry.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: apologize, apology, i-m-sorry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Vultures pick the meat clean off a bone. Guilt eats at the marrow, leaving a man hollow.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: guilt, guilt-quote, guilty, guilty-conscience, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, vultures

quote: A pang of guilt, like a blaring siren, should never be ignored.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: guilt, guiltiness, guilty-conscience, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: This feeling of guilt is your conscience calling your attention to the higher road, and your heart wishing you had taken it.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: conscience, feeling-of-guilt, guilt, guiltiness, guilty-conscience, higher-road, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Consider guilt like a street sign that warns of rough roads ahead if you don’t make a u-turn.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: guilt, guiltiness, guilty-conscience, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, warning

quote: When dragons attack, the only thing you should seek to stand behind is your own sword.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: attacking-dragons, dragons, fighting-your-own-battles, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-defense

quote: I’m sorry. Oh, what simple words are these!I’m sorry. Lips should breathe them out with ease!But nay, in barring up the way,“I’ll die first” are the words you say.I’m sorry, woe is all pride guarantees.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: apologetic, apologies, apology, i-m-sorry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sorry

quote: Go put on your mask.Say 'trick-or-treat' in costume.It’s All Hallows Eve.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: haiku, halloween, halloween-poem, hallows-eve, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: All human beings wield influence—a powerful sword granted at birth. Wield your sword with care.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: clout, impact, influence, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Some people do not like you
author: that’s a given. So what?

quote: The cup is both half full and half empty
author: it has never been one or the other. Stop obsessing over a trivial point and be thankful you have something to drink.

quote: Birthdays were made for going wild over the people we think are amazing.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: birthday, birthdays, happy-birthday, my-birthday, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Anyone who takes the time to attentively listen is either an old soul or a romantic one.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: listener, listening, old-soul, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, romantic-soul, taking-time-to-listen

quote: No one believes he is an idiot until the consequences of his actions prove it. Then hindsight rubs it in.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: consequences, idiot, poor-choices, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, stupidity

quote: To actively improve the worldand change your life as well,speak all the good you know,and all the bad refuse to tell.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: don-t-gossip, gossip, improving-the-world, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, say-good-things, speak-kindly, speak-well

quote: The elixir of life is a bubbling stream of laughter.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: elixir-of-life, humor, laugh, laugh-out-loud, laughing, laughter, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I once dreamt that the man in the moon took an interest in me and reflected the sun’s light directly in my path, lighting the way for my footsteps to sink themselves into the ground. It was wonderful to have my course illuminated by one with a grander perspective than my own. But when I awoke, realizing I could not call on the moon for guidance, my spirit sank until it occurred to me I could talk to the one who had created the moon. And He has lit my path ever since.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: god-s-direction, guidance, illuminated-path, life-s-path, light-my-path, man-in-the-moon, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The day you were bornHeaven wept at its great loss,Earth joyed at its gain.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: birthday, born, day-you-were-born, happy-birthday, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The secret to style is a beautiful smile.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: class, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, smile, smiling, style

quote: The best bubbly I ever tasted was laughter.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: bubbly, laugh, laughter, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Laughter can deflate almost any problem down to its proper size.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: big-problems, laugh, laughter, problems, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, small-problems

quote: Quit acting like everything is so serious. Most situations aren’t as bad as you fear, and those that are might benefit from a little laughter.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: benefits-of-laughter, laugh, laughter, laughter-is-he-best-medicine, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: To look in the mirror and smile is a challenge for many people. Those who do so without the slightest scowl are indeed fortunate.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: look-in-the-mirror, love-yourself, loving-yourself, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-confidence, self-image, smile, smiling

quote: If you mess with dragons, you will get burned. Don’t say no one warned you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: burned, dangers, dragons, get-burned, messing-with-dragons, playing-with-fire, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The real me isn’t someone you see but someone you know.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: knowing-me, me, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-real-me

quote: You won’t solve your problems by drowning others in them.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: dilemmas, problems, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, solving-your-problems, trials, troubles, troubling-others

quote: The best fathers have the softest, sweetest hearts. In other words, great dads are real marshmallows.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: dad-s-day, dads, father-s-day, fathers, great-dads, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-best-fathers

quote: Stubbornness is a weapon.People tend to draw it out when a sensitive part of their identity is threatened—be it dignity, honor, pride, desires, etc. If loaded with righteous resolve, stubbornness can assist in overcoming obstacles and achieving great feats; however, more often than not it is loaded with anger, used as a means of destruction for both the possessor and those whom he turns his weapon upon. It is best utilized by wise individuals who are able to dispassionately perceive if their stubbornness will accomplish good, or if it should be put away and replaced by a humble substitute to spare the lives of everyone affected.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: headstrong, obstinacy, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, stubborn, stubbornness

quote: A hero is a person who, without a second thought, simply does the right thing because his conscience cannot live with any other choice.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: conscience, doing-right, hero, heroes, heroism, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Heroes don’t have the need to be known as heroes, they just do what heroes do because it is right and it must be done.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: do-what-is-right, do-what-must-be-done, hero, heroes, heroism, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Meanness is a monster that usurps your self-control because you cowardly allow it to conquer you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: being-mean, mean, meanness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-control, unkindness

quote: Learn to brush off criticism as easily as you brush aside hollow compliments.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: brush-off, critical, criticism, ignore-critics, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: A gentleman willNever allow a ladyTo feel less than grand.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: gentleman, gentlemen, haiku, haiku-quotes, lady, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Integrity is more than truth and honesty; integrity is an unshackled mind, a happy heart, and a light spirit. Integrity is inner peace with a clear, clean conscience. Integrity is self-respect, honor, and credibility. Integrity is healthy and unfettering, and it is worth defending.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: conscience, credibility, happy-heart, honor, inner-peace, integrity, light-spirit, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-respect

quote: When gossip starts, be deaf.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons

quote: If life is a stage and you are your own agent, then don’t hesitate to play the character you wish to play.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-yourself, life, life-is-a-stage, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-confidence

quote: Remembering our loved ones is breathing life into their fading images, that we might once more see their faces and pass along a tearful “I miss you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: grieving, i-love-you, memorial-day, memorial-day-quotes, missing-someone, remember, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I cast my eyes out to the seaAnd gaze at all eternity.until forever turns to night.My eyes then lift to catch starlight.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: eternity, forever, night, poems, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sea, sky, starlight

quote: If I were to sit on the ocean floor and look toward the sky,I might see a whale or electric eel or octopus pass by.And if I decided to jump straight up and reach with open arms,I might feel the pleasure of ocean flight propel me ’mid their swarms.But if I were seated upon the shore and looking toward the stars,I might see a comet or falling star near Mercury or Mars.Then if I decided to jump straight up and reach with open hands,I might feel despair when my feet refused to leave the shoreline sand.And so I return to the ocean depths where swimming creatures fly,For there I can soar with the whales and fish that daily touch the sky.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: fly, flying, ocean, ocean-waters, poems, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sky, soaring, stars

quote: It is important that we reme
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons

quote: Patience is real self-mastery.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-patient, patience, patience-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-mastery

quote: In one way or another,you owe your life to Mother.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: mom, mom-s-day, mommy, mother, mother-s-day, mothers, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Observe the Lord’s Day as he would have you, and perhaps He will observe your days as you would have Him.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: day-of-rest, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sabbath-day, sunday, the-lord-s-day

quote: Rather than critique people, try admiring God’s creative handiwork.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: admiration, criticism, critique, critiquing-others, judging-others, positivity, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Patience isn’t simply waiting, it is caring enough about the situation and those involved to remain calm and courteous throughout the wait.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: being-patient, calm, courteous, patience, patience-quotes, patient, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, wait, waiting

quote: Extraordinary power exists in a trial of patience. Few endure their trials well enough to discover this.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-patient, patience, patience-quotes, patient, patient-people, power-of-patience, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, trial-of-patience, trials, wait, waiting

quote: Progressing at a snail’s pace is still progress, and slow progress is better than no progress. Never be stagnant, and never give up.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: keep-going, never-give-up, progessing, progress, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, small-steps, step-by-step

quote: When we all part from this life and gather on the other side, the only thing each of us will have to share is his own story.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: death, dying, end-of-mortality, life, passing-on, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: It may seem like the dragons tormenting you are bigger and fiercer than those lurking in your neighbor’s yard, but this is an illusion. We all face mighty dragons at home in some form.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: comparing-yourself-to-others, difficulties-in-life, dragons, problems, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, trials

quote: Problems are never as difficult as when they are your own.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: difficulties, personal-problems, problems, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, trials

quote: My mother does not own my hands, though she works hard to train them. My mother does not own my eyes, though she frequently directs their focus. My mother does not own my mind, though she yields great influence upon it. My heart, however, she owns completely, for it was hers the day I was born.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: mom, mother, mother-s-day, mother-s-love, motherhood, mothering, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: One of the strongest loves I’ve ever witnessed is the love a mother has for her child.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Return of a Queen
category: mom, moms, moms-love, mother-s-day, mother-s-love, mothers, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Sunshine warms us, as do smiles—which makes me think that smiles are sunbeams reflected off our teeth.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, smile-more, smile-quotes, smiles, smiling, smiling-big

quote: I never knew what Mother knowed,Like how a thread and needle sewed,And how a kiss healed boo-boos fast.Why family knots were made to last.I never knew how Mother sawA caring man in angry pa,A smile beneath the teary gloom,A game inside a messy room.I never knowed what Mother knew,Like how to smile when days were blue,And how to laugh for laughter’s sake,While giving up her slice of cake.I never saw what Mother see’dLike honor pulling garden weeds,Or deep confessions in a look,And hope alive in storybooks.I never knew how Mother knowedTo hand out carrots when it snowed,And why hot cocoa liked the rain,While naptime kept a person sane.For mother knowed and see’d it all.A winner in a strike-out ball.A 'yes, please' in a shoulder shrug.A 'love you mostest' in a hug.Perhaps, someday, I’ll come to knowWhat Mother saw and knowed as so.Like how 'I’m right' can be all wrong,And why the night requires a song.But of the things I learned and knewI never doubted one thing true.My mother made it crystal clear,she knowed and loved me ever dear.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: mommy, mother, mother-s-day, mother-s-love, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: It’s simply this:the Irish kiss,a snog o’ bliss,be blessed luckfrom any miss.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: good-luck, irish, irish-kiss, irish-romance, luck, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, st-patrick-s-day

quote: The wind is made of haunting souls that moan and groan in whistles and whispers. This ghostly choir chills the breeze and orchestrates a rise of goose bumps on my skin.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: breeze, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-wind, wind, wind-quotes, windy

quote: Be sure to wear greenon March seventeen,or else Irish leprechauns pinch your bones clean!
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: irish, leprechauns, march-seventeen, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, st-patrick-s-day

quote: Impatience is racing at misery full speed.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: impatience, misery, patience, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: On Easter we wrap up pretty, little decorated eggs symbolizing life and renewal. We do this because of the intangibility of a promised gift, which is the eventual resurrection of the body, restored to its finest forever state. Easter celebrates life and the idea of its eternal value, most notably the life of the gift-giver who demands nothing in return. He is your Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons

quote: Things that remind me of Mother are these:the truth ‘mid deception, a warm summer breeze,the calm within chaos, a stitch in a rip,a comforting blanket, the smile on her lip,an ocean of love in a heart big as whales,the morals in everyday stories she tells,a wink amid laughter, the wisdom in books,the peace in humility, beauty in looks,the light and the life in a ray of the sun,the hard work accomplished disguised as pure fun,concern in a handclasp, encouragement too,the hope in a clear morning sky azure blue,the power in prayers uttered soft and sincere,the faith in a promise, and joy in a tear.These things all attest to the wonder and graceof my precious mother, none else could replace.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: mom, mother, mother-s-day, motherhood, mothers-love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I wear my wrinkles like battle scars, having earned every last one slaying life’s dragons. They boast of my victories and some defeats while their beauty is a wealth of wisdom gained.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: aging, aging-quotes, battle-scars, growing-old, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, wrinkle-lines, wrinkles

quote: When I ask you to be my valentine, I’m not asking you to love me. I’m simply asking you to accept tokens of my love for you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-my-valentine, love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, valentine, valentine-s-day, valentine-s-day-quotes

quote: The whispers you hear in your ear that you fear in the air everywhere,they are ghosts.The moans and the groans in the lowest of tones no one owns or condones, they are ghosts.You might deem them gremlins or water or wind,while others say shadows or rodents or sin.But oh! I say no! ‘Tis not so, child, for lo!The chills that you feel in a thrill that proves goose bumps are frightfully real,they are ghosts!
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: ghosts, halloween, halloween-poems, hallows-eve, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: It seems there's confusion at this time of yearregarding the reason for Christmas.From shopping for presents to spreading good cheer,the world makes an overly huge fuss.But Christmas is not for the gifts we exchange.It's not about sleigh rides or sweet candy canes.Nay, Christmas is simple. A time to recallChrist's gift of atonement He gave to us all.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: christmas, christmas-quotes, christmas-spirit, christmastime, holiday-season, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: To believe in yourself is to light a spark with the potential to start a fire.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: believe-in-yourself, potential, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-confidence, self-worth, slaying-dragons, worth

quote: You can do things. Do you know this?Do you believe it?You should.It’s true.You can do great things.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: ability, do-it, potential, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-worth, slaying-dragons, talent, worth

quote: I know they don’t respect the lives of others…”“Mortals,” he specified, “who exist for a brief moment and then die off.”Her voice rose as she argued with him. “I speak of people with very valued lives, Edgar. It may seem like a moment to you, but to me it is eternity.”“That makes no sense.”“It makes perfect sense, Edgar! Life is valuable—period. And because mine can be easily taken away, it becomes even more valuable and precious. Yours, you take for granted because you’ll never lose it. Mine, I cherish because it’s fleeting. For that reason alone I can argue that my life is of the greatest worth.”His eyebrows pulled together over a tangled scowl. She couldn’t tell if he was trying to understand her reasoning or if she had merely managed to upset him.“Never mind,” she mumbled. “I don’t think you can appreciate what you’ve never experienced.“That works both ways, Amora.”“Whatever.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Curse of Wanyaka Cave
category: edgar, eena, immortals, mortals, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Too often we let others stamp a price tag on us, and we accept their appraisal of our worth, forgetting we are in fact priceless.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: happiness, priceless, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-confidence, self-respect, self-worth, worth

quote: The spirit of Christmas exists in harmonious carols like those sung by angels on the day of Christ’s birth.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: angels, carols, christ-s-birth, christmas, christmas-carols, christmas-quotes, christmas-spirit, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, spirit-of-christmas

quote: Treats and tricks.Witch broomsticks.Jack-o-lanternsLick their lips.Crows and cats.Vampire bats.Capes and fangsAnd pointed hats.Werewolves howl.Phantoms prowl.Halloween’s Upon us now.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: halloween, halloween-poem, halloween-quotes, hallows-eve, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: You breathe.You feel.You seeand hearand smelland tasteand thinkand moveand laughand weepand healand danceand singand love.Thank your mother.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: mom, mother, mother-s-day, mother-s-day-quotes, motherhood, mothers, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, thank-you

quote: Anyone who takes the time to listen is either an old soul or a romantic one.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: listen, listen-to-me, listening, listening-to-others, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: A pumpkin lives but once a year when someone sets its soul afire and on that night it stirs up fear until its flame is snuffed.But e'en one night of eerie light is fright enough.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: halloween, halloween-poem, halloween-poems, halloween-quotes, hallows-eve, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The coldest day in fallis at the Hallows Evening ballwhere ghoulish funavoids the sunas monsters mingle wall to wall.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: halloween, halloween-poem, halloween-quotes, hallows-eve, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I do listen. I just wait for the words to stop and your eyes to speak.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: expressions, eyes, hearing, i-am-listening, listen, listening, nonverbal-communication, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: A smile is a light that sets your inner self aglow, letting others know you’re home.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: happiness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, slaying-dragons, smile, smiling

quote: A Halloween flower,if ever there was one,would smell like an onion,have thorns like a rose.With charcoal black petalsand vines that entangle,t'would grow under moonlightin mud, I suppose.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: halloween, halloween-poem, halloween-quotes, hallows-eve, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The truth is, when you have little to do, you do very little. But when you have much to do, you do much. So it should make sense that by taking on more than you can handle, you accomplish more than you ever dreamed you could. And so it is.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: accomplishing-things, accomplishments, achievements, achievers, do-it, do-more, doing-great-things, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, success

quote: Witches cackle.Goblins growl.Spectres boo,And werewolves howl.Black cats hiss.Bats flap their wings.Mummies moan.The cold wind sings.Ogre’s roar.And crows, they caw.Vampires bahahahaha.Warlocks swish their moonlit capes.Loch Ness monsters churn the lake.Skeletons, they rattle bonesWhile graveyards crack the old headstones.All the while the ghouls, they cryTo trick-or-treaters passing by.Oh, the noise on Halloween;It makes me want to scream!
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: halloween, halloween-poem, halloween-quotes, hallows-eve, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: One day a week I seek to rest from earthly toil and sorrow.Revitalized, I find the strength to battle new tomorrows.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: day-of-rest, relax, relaxation, rest, revitalization, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sabbath, sabbath-day, sabbath-rest

quote: If all of our sins, bad habits, and poor choices were permanently inked into our skin like tattoos, we would all dress quite modestly.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: bad-habits, embarrassment, guilt, poor-choices, regret, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, shame, sins

quote: Love in its essence is unconditional. When conditions, exceptions, and ultimatums are cast into the mix, its purity changes. It is no longer love and should be referred to by a less-desirable name.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: love, love-quotes, pure-love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, true-love

quote: You are mistaken
author: he is not a gentleman but a sir. Just a sir. For a gentleman is grander and a rare acquaintance.

quote: When you understand that faith is God’s muscle at your disposal, moving mountains doesn’t seem so extraordinary.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: belief-quotes, faith, faith-at-work, faith-in-god, faith-quotes, moving-mountains, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Love is the ultimate no-calorie sweetener.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: love, love-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, valentine-s-day, valentines-day

quote: How easy it is to slip.How hard it is to climb.How wise it is to keep in stepAnd never fall behind.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: don-t-procrastinate, keep-up, perservere, procrastinate, procrastination, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, work-ethic, work-hard

quote: Sometimes the craziest laugh in the world is the only one that will save your sanity.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: craziness, insanity, laugh, laughter, life-quotes, mental-health, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: If we were to behave half as well as we believe others ought to behave, we might prove ourselves as grand in character as excuses and justifications prevent us from being.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: behavior, excuses, expectations, expectations-of-others, justifications, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I can be tolerant of traffic jams and disorganization, faulty technology, miserable weather, and bland foods. People, however, require more than the cold, grudging favor of being tolerated. They require love.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: love, loving-people, people, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, tolerance, tolerate

quote: There are tomorrows on their way worth the struggles of today. Never give up.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: don-t-quit, endurance, endure, fight, keep-going, never-give-up, persistence, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, try, willpower

quote: Snowflakes fall from high.Flurries lift and twirl below.The world has turned white.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: christmas, christmas-quotes, christmastime, haiku, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, snow, snow-flurries, snowflakes

quote: Glittering tinsel,lights, glass balls, and candy canesdangle from pine trees.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: christmas, christmas-quotes, christmas-tree, christmastime, haiku, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: New light in the skyannounces a sacred birth.Shine brightly young star.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: christmas, haiku, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, star-of-bethlaham

quote: Dress the part! Invent and pretend to your heart’s content! Act, sing, and dance while everyone’s watching! The world’s a stage, remember?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: act, be, dance, perform, pretend, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sing, the-world-s-a-stage

quote: There are many pitfalls in life
author: one is dwelling on blame. It’s pointless. Move on.

quote: So you had a bad day. Kick it aside and be grateful for one less bad day to pass through.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: bad-day, bright-side, count-your-blessings, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I drifted off after a while, staring at the only star visible through the thick covering of leaves. Hope seemed a futile wish, but I troubled the lonely star to grant it anyway.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse
category: hope, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, tarishe-curse, wish, wishing-on-a-star

quote: Humans are forever discontent—always thinking there are better alternatives to their present circumstances.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: discontent, discontentment, humans, regret, restlessness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, unhappiness, wanting-more

quote: Problems don’t actually exist. They’re just the hallucinogenic effects of people being weirded out on what they think life is supposed to be.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: assumptions, expectations, life, presumptions, problems, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, weirded-out, wishes

quote: We change when circumstances necessitate it
author: we adapt because we have to. The real challenge is to change when circumstances don’t demand it at all.

quote: The richest people are those who have an abundance of what we take with us into the next life.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: next-life, rich-people, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, riches, things-of-value, things-of-worth

quote: It is my belief that almost anyone can be had with breadcrumbs. For if you leave a trail of the right variety, your prey will come straight to you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: breadcrumbs, entice, enticements, lure, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, temptations

quote: My life is a fairytale stuck at the climax.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: fairytale, life, life-is, life-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: There are two kinds of people in this world: those who follow the popular majority, and those who possess good sense. In other words, you can either let the crowd steer you right over a cliff, or you can stop to peer beyond the brink and see how a fall will likely end in tragedy.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: be-smart, common-sense, followers, good-sense, leaders, peer-pressure, popular-majority, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, think-ahead, think-it-through

quote: The greater self-confidence an individual possesses, the less inclined he is to put down others. This says a lot about those who constantly belittle.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: belittling, criticism, put-downs, putting-down, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-confidence, self-image, self-worth

quote: I wish upon a glimmering star,My hopes as distant and as far. So if this wish does not come true,I’m thankful for the few that do.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: dreams, hopes, making-wishes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, thankfulness, wishes, wishing-star

quote: Don't ignore me. I only get more annoying.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway

quote: I’ve had the kind of bad day no quote can fix.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: bad-day, discouragement, quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Teach me to sing and recite,To whistle and jingle and strum.Teach me to color and paint,To sculpt and weave and create.Teach me to sway and dance,To tap and leap and twirl.Teach me to laugh and giggle,To tickle and play and pretend.Teach me that life is beautiful.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: appreciate-life, giggle, laugh, life-is-beautiful, life-quotes, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, teach-me

quote: What a mother wants is to hold her babies when they’re small and to be held by them once they’ve grown tall. It’s empty arms a mother dreads.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: babies, held, holding-on, mom, mother, mother-s-day, mother-s-day-quotes, mothers, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Your life is a personal lesson. For everyone else it is a loud example.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: example, exemplar, life, life-lessons, model, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, standard

quote: Fathers are… The teeth on a saw,The head of a nail,The blades on a mower.Fathers are…The grit in a tumbler,The cement in the pit,The coin for the machine.Fathers are…The air in the tires,The spring in the suspension,The key to the ignition.Fathers are... the confidence in a dare,The energy of a command,The boots for the trail.Tis true you might make things work without them, but not at all like they were meant to.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: dads, father-s-day, father-s-day-quotes, fathers, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I once thought it would take a miracle to improve my circumstances. Now, I believe it will take something far more powerful, if such a thing exists.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: change, circumstances, improving, improving-your-circumstances, life, making-wishes, miracles, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: If only I could see myself from the same vantage point that I observe the world; I might judge my behavior and expressions more critically, and others less.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: criticism, judging, observing, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Making a wish is fun to do.Dreaming it out is much fun too.Work, and your wish just might come true.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: dreaming, making-wishes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, wishes-come-true

quote: Beauty isn’t visible; I don’t know why people think it is. Perhaps because at times there are physical manifestations suggesting beauty exists in a person, but don’t be fooled. Beauty isn’t the packaging, it’s the treasure wrapped up inside.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: beautiful-people, beauty, beauty-standards, internal-beauty, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I've yet to find another soul who believes in me with the same fervency as my mother.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: believe-in-me, mom, mother, mother-s-day, mother-s-day-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: MOM—Mistress Of Miracles
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
