quote: Was mutual need enough to risk trusting a calculated enemy in hopes of destroying a more powerful one?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse

quote: In the middle of a grocery store, two children were horsing around (one holding the other in a headlock) when the mother turned abruptly to give them a stern repr
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: act-like-an-adult, example, following-your-example, humor, parenthood, raising-kids, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I dream of defeating tyrants and ogres as well as circumstances and consequences that I cannot conquer in life. I dream of a love as sweet and addictive as chocolate-coated rose petals yet as tenacious as a thirsty vampire and as enduring as immortality. I dream of things improbable and boldly insane.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: dreams, improbable, life, love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Southern DADDY—Dandy At Doin’ Diapers Y’all!
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: daddy, dads, diapers, fathers, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I am not what you see.I am what time and effort and interaction slowly unveil.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: appearances, effort, getting-to-know-me, getting-to-know-someone, i-am, interaction, know-me, looks, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-real-me, time

quote: Be loved for who you are, for everything that constitutes you. Be loved for your core beliefs, your strengths and weaknesses, your admirable traits and troublesome baggage. Be loved for you, because anything less is not love at all.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: be-loved, being-loved, love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, true-love

quote: When there is not enough time to do your best, do the best you can with the time you have.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: best, do-your-best, effort, good-works, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I think I'd rather be liked than loved. It just seems as if more criticism and chastening is shown to those we love, while kind manners and compassion are reserved for those we simply like. So, I hope you like me.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: chastening, criticism, liked, love-quotes, loved, loving, relationships, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: A princess once carefully kissed a porcupine to be kind, upon which he began to think himself a prince. He then dressed like a prince, behaved like a prince, and announced himself to be a prince. The world, therefore, saw him as such, and so a porcupine prince he was. (Of course, most were reluctant to argue with him otherwise.)
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: porcupine, porcupine-prince, power-of-belief, princess, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-image

quote: Stubbornness is surely just taut-jawed, clenched-fisted madness.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: doggedness, madness, obstinacy, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, stubborn, stubbornness

quote: The bulk of life is discovering who you are—and then reconciling that with who you wish you were.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: finding-yourself, life, life-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, self-discovery, who-am-i, who-you-are

quote: They say to never look back.But sometimes I do. It’s gratifying to see how far I’ve come.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: accomplishment, looking-back, making-wishes, progress, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, small-steps

quote: Oh, how clearly I see your faults! Such distinctly highlighted flaws; it's as if the sun and moon mean to keep them illuminated in my eyes. My mind is quick to spell out a simple remedy for those defects. But alas, poor me! My own faults―which I only assume to have because all do―are blurred and obscured by a mental fog. I've no eyes with which to gaze back at myself. The sun and moon refuse their illumination, and my mind offers no sure elixir but a complex recipe scribbled in foreign words I scarcely comprehend.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: fault-finding, faults, judging-others, making-wishes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Stand tall on the summit after a tedious climb. Take in the remarkable scenery and the exhilaration of accomplishment. But don't pause for long
author: there are greater mountains to climb while you still possess the drive and capacity to do so.

quote: Wilted or in bloom,taking or lending daylight,the world transitions.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: change, haiku, nature, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, seasons, transitions

quote: Sail through the good days, and on bad days pick a spot of blue sky to steer toward.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: bad-days, coping, good-days, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sail

quote: Life is the clay from which dreams are molded.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: dreams, life, making-dreams-come-true, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I wished upon the moon one night, bewitched by how it shone so white. While staring up with some excite my eyes beheld a wondrous sight!  The moon so lustrous and white transformed into an armored knight who caused me just a moments fright when he jumped down from such a height.  No more a soft, celestial light, he was my lover, day and night.   This caused the world a serious plight.  How harsh a sting and deep the bite inflicted on the world, alright, to lose their blackest-hour light.  And so I've come to set things right, to offer up without a fight my lover wished for one clear night.  I hold him close.  He hugs me tight, then climbs again to heaven's height to glow a bluer shade of bright.  I stare at my beloved knight, not wanting to be impolite, and in my heart with all my might I wish a wish that isn't right.  Now and then the world still spites a shadowless and moonless night when we steal softly out of sight to hold each other 'til daylight and share in lovers true delight.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: moon, moonlight, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Oh, mightiest wind,wilt thou cease thy breathing inand hold thy exhales?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: haiku, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, storms, weather, wind, windy

quote: The truth is that few know the truth.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Secrets of a Noble Key Keeper
category: dreamland, gavin, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, secrets-of-a-noble-key-keeper, truth

quote: Twinkle tiny star.Oh, how great you truly are!God's sign from afar.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: christmas, christmas-quotes, christmas-star, haiku, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, star

quote: A whiff of fresh mintthat tastes like strawberry pie.Your kisses tempt me.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: haiku, kisses, kissing, love, love-quotes, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Though I love you to the core of my being, so thoroughly that every cell comprising me aches to be near you, I must accept that we can never be together. For our existence parallels the sun and the moon—a temptation in constant, beautiful view, yet if the sun were ever to kiss the moon it would devour the heavenly orb whole. Oh, my darling, if only I were the moon! Then I would dare taste your lips and be happy for my last and final joy! But alas, I am the sun, and I will not venture to destroy the one I love.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: forbidden-love, lost-love, love, love-letter, love-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, starcrossed-love

quote: The key to a better life isn't always a change of scenery. Sometimes it simply requires opening your eyes.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: change, changes-in-life, improving, life-quotes, new-beginnings, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, scenery, starting-over

quote: Fathers...Rise at dawn.Stand up strong.Fix and build.Plow the field.Carry the weight.Work 'til late.Encourage our dreams.Provide the means.Fight with might.Defend what's right.Protect the home.Refuse to roam.Forge the way.Take time to play.Spoil our moms.Keep homelife calm.And all becauseof selfless love.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: father, father-s-day, fathers, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Time machines, magic portals, transporters, worm holes, flying carpets, relocation charms—such things do exist. They're called books.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: book-lovers, book-quotes, books, reading, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-magic-of-reading, time-machines

quote: Because," said a boy."Because why?" asked a young girl."Because I love you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: because, boy, girl, haiku, love, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, young-love

quote: Reading...inspires,enlightens,nurtures,refines,educates,informs,transforms,persuades,challenges,engages, entertains,mesmerizes,captivates,gratifies,rewards,quiets,and calms.Granted, it won't get the dishes done,but sacrifices must be made.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: benefits-of-reading, book-quotes, books, read-a-book, readers, reading, reading-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The blue of daylightfades and chills as the sun sinksbeneath clouds of fire.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: haiku, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sunset

quote: There are no real start-overs, only start-from-heres.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: do-it-again, never-give-up, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, start-from-here, start-over, start-over-again, try, try-again

quote: Be careful what you wish for. It may turn out that making the wish was the only good part.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: dreaming, hoping, jealousy, longing, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, wanting, wish, wishing

quote: Compliments land assoft and gentle on my earsas a butterfly.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: compliments, haiku, kind-words, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The first real day of spring is like the first time a boy holds your hand. A flood of skin-tingling warmth consumes you, and everything shines with a fresh, colorful glow, making you forget that anything as cold and harsh as winter ever existed.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: change-of-seasons, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, spring, springtime

quote: You stare at your dream from a distance, longing, sighing, seeing what you deem is a warning of IMPOSSIBLE. But if you would squint real hard you would see the truth; the sign correctly reads 'I'M POSSIBLE.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes

quote: A finger beckons.My choice is to turn away.It is a mistake.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: anxiety, concern, dread, fear, haiku, poetry, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, suspicion, worry

quote: Love is an afternoon of fishing when I'd sooner be at the ballet. Love is eating burnt toast and lumpy graving with a big s
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: love, love-quotes, loving-another, loving-someone, relationships, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, valentine, valentine-s-day, valentines-day

quote: Corned beef and cabbage and leprechaun men.Colorful rainbows hide gold at their end.Shamrocks and clovers with three leaves plus one.Dress up in green—add a top hat for fun.Steal a quick kiss from the lasses in red.A tin whistle tune off the top of my head.Friends, raise a goblet and offer this to
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: cabbage, clover, corned-beef, green, irish, lasses, leprechauns, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, saint-patricks-day, shamrock, st-patrick-s-day

quote: The earth provides us a brand new beginning every twenty-four hours. It is a repeated invitation to breathe in the cool morning air and start afresh; to mimic the sunrise and brighten up while reaching once more for the sky; to carry a glad song in our heart like the early birds; and, as faithfully as the morning dew, to wash off the dust from yesterday.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: begin-again, beginning, brand-new, earth, new-beginnings, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, start-over, try-again

quote: Mothers were meant to love us unconditionally, to understand our moments of stupidity, to reprimand us for lame excuses while yet acknowledging our point of view, to weep over our pain and failures as well as cry at our joy and successes, and to cheer us on despite countless start-overs. Heaven knows no one else will.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: love, mom, mommy, mother-s-day, mother-s-love, mothers, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Moms are life's number one cheerleaders without uniforms.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: cheering, cheerleaders, mom, moms, mother-s-day, mothers, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: A first impression works like a magic mirror; it reflects what intrigues us rather than echoing a truthful picture. A first impression is the creating of an imagined character born from personal desires, perceptions, and biases. Though sparked by an introduction to a real, living, breathing individual, the person remains a mystery long after parting. It is a fictitious ghost masked with similar features that remains. A first impression is rarely accurate; therefore, it should never be trusted.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: first-impressions, judging, judging-others, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Your weaknesses may not seem overwhelming, but they will create the biggest problems you face.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: challenges, irony, life-lessons, life-s-problems, problems, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, weakness, weaknesses

quote: It's silly to think the left eye would envy the right or that one foot would be jealous of the other, and yet so often it is the case.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: envious, envy, jealous, jealousy, resentfulness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Anyone who looks good with a bald head is seriously sexy.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: bald, bald-head, baldness, gorgeous, looks, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sexy

quote: A man once believed he could fly—and he did. Another believed he could walk on the moon—and he did. Why not believe your wildest dreams can come true? Why not see the stars as reachable?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: ambitions, dreams, hopes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, stars, wishes

quote: I dreamed my shoulders held up the sky for a thousand hawks that squawked and cawed and beat their feathered wings against the hotness of the day. I supported their flight, watching and marveling, until sweat dripped from my body, and groans crossed my lips over fatiguing muscles. Choosing to let the sky fall, I awoke. My eyes opened to a cast of hawks gripping me in their talons. They supported my weight, hauling me high above the clouds through a blue expanse of heaven. And though they struggled—squawking and flapping wearily—never once did a single bird release its hold.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: aid, aide, charity, hawks, help, perseverance, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, stick-to-it, support

quote: From the beginning, man could look up at a vast universe dotted by innumerable stars to find every evidence that he was nothing. This evidence only grows stronger as science and technology record an expanse of galaxies filled with planetary solar systems beyond any visible end. Man is but a grain of sand lost on an endless seashore, and yet he believes with conviction in his own greatness.  He is either a divine soul intuitively aware of his inherent, limitless potential—or he is a blind fool.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: mankind, personal-worth, potential, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, soul-quotes, worth, worth-of-a-soul

quote: Laughter and love are their own forms of exercise meant to keep a body healthy.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: excercise, laughter, love, love-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: There are times you find yourself standing by the wayside, watching as someone struggles to dig a well with a spoon, and you wish with all your heart you had arms and a shovel.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: care, caring, charity, helping, helping-others, helpless, helplessness, love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sympathy, wish

quote: It is in the coldest months that hugs linger snug, and they warm the soul the most.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: cold, cold-months, cold-weather, hugging, hugs, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, snug, winter

quote: Those things that challenge the worst in us tend to strengthen the best in us.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: best-in-us, challenges, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, trials, trials-of-life, tribulations, worst-in-us

quote: Obsessing over something that has jarred your world is called coping.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: agitated, calamity, coping, jarred, misery, misfortune, obsessing, rattled, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, tragedy

quote: There is no such thing as constructive criticism. There is constructive advice, constructive guidance, constructive counsel, encouragement, suggestion, and instruction. Criticism, however, is not constructive but a destructive means of faultfinding that cripples all parties involved. Don't be fooled into thinking otherwise.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: crippling, criticism, destructive, fault-finding, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Minutes turn into hours that add up to days amounting to weeks that become  months melting into yearsaccumulating for decadesto pile up for centuriesand ultimately form minutes again―just on a grander, divine scale.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: centuries, days, decades, hours, life, minutes, months, perceptions, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, time, years

quote: There are no rest stops on the road of life. Otherwise they'd be congested with traffic.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: break, challenges, hardships, life, pause, rest, rest-stop, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, road-of-life, trials

quote: It wasn't a kiss that changed the frog, but the fact that a young girl looked beneath warts and slime and believed she saw a prince. So he became one.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: appearance, frog, frog-prince, judgement, judging, looking, prince, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Mothers care in volumes of tears and earnestness of prayers and a depth of emotion others cannot fathom.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: caring, devotion, love, mom, moms, mother, mother-s-day, mother-s-love, mothers, mothers-care, mothers-day, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The Harvest Moon glows round and bold,In pumpkin shades outlined in gold,Illuminating eerie forms,Unnatural as a candied corn.Beware what dare crawls up your sleeve,For 'tis the night called Hallows Eve.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: all-hallows-eve, halloween, halloween-poem, hallows-eve, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: We wait for the rains to cease, the clouds to part, and the sun to shine before saying life is good. Ironically, it is because we endure the storms that life seems so wonderfully bright at their passing.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: life, life-is-good, life-quotes, outlook, perceptions, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Autumn is a cunning muse who steals by degrees my warmth and light. So distracted by her glorious painting of colors, I scarcely realize my losses until the last fiery leaf has fallen to the ground and the final pumpkin shrinks. Autumn departs with a cold kiss, leaving me to suffer the frigid grasp of winter in prolonged nightfall.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: autumn, autumn-quotes, change-of-seasons, fall, fall-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, winter

quote: A monster's worst fear is of being found.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Secrets of a Noble Key Keeper
category: being-found, discovered, fear, monster, monsters, monsters-under-the-bed, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: While silently brooding, I am drawn to the start of a sweet melody that travels to my ear from afar. I smile, reminded that my heart can dance when my feet can't.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: dance, dancing, love-of-music, music, music-appreciation, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Life is a walk through the forest. Don't fear the trees, fear what lurks behind them.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: fear, forest, life, life-quotes, life-s-unknowns, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, trees, unknown

quote: Sometimes while gazing at the night's sky, I imagine stars looking down making wishes on the brightest of us.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: dreams, night-sky, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, star-gazing, stars, wish-upon-a-star, wishes

quote: Saying 'I'm sorry' is saying 'I love you' with a wounded heart in one hand and your smothered pride in the other.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: apologize, apologizing, apology, i-love-you, i-m-sorry, love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sorry

quote: Your tongue tends to say more about you when it blabs about other people.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: babble, blab, blabbing, chatter, gossip, hearsay, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, rumor, talk

quote: It is to our own detriment that we underestimate the might of small and simple things.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: mighty, overlook, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, simple, simplicity, small-and-simple-things, small-steps, small-things, underestimate

quote: A truly humble apology works to part storm clouds, calm rough seas, and bring on the soft lights of dawn; it has the power to change a person's world.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: apologies, apologize, apologizing, apology, change, humble, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Announcing the intended arrival of some people is kind of like issuing a hurricane warning.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: bad-company, company, guests, hurricane, relatives, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, tornado, unwanted-company, visitors

quote: It's too bad we're not all teddy bears. More stuffing would only make us cuter and cuddlier.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: cuddlier, cuddly, cute, cuter, fat, plump, pudgy, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, stout, stuffed, stuffing, teddy-bear

quote: The least effort is the feat most likely to be accomplished.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: easy, effort, feat, lazy, least-effort, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, simplest, simplest-ways

quote: If one is content to freely speak trash about another, it is probably more correct to judge them as the one of ill repute and refuse the load of garbage they offer you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: gossip, gossiping, hearsay, idle-talk, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, rumors, scandal, slander

quote: Who cares who's right or wrong when the last word is a kind apology?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: apologize, apologizing, apology, i-m-sorry, meekness, regret, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, right, right-or-wrong, sorry, wrong

quote: Learn to look up now and then, just in case a piano is falling from overhead.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: be-aware, be-observant, humor-quotes, look-up, observant, piano, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Patience isn't tested when it is self-imposed and the duration is self-regulated. Patience is hardly tested when the outcome means little to you. However, when circumstances beyond your control force you to wait with baited breath knowing the outcome will affect your life substantially, that is the true test of patience. It is a cage inside a burning building where every exit is blocked by angels calmly advising you to wait a moment longer. Your choice is to either trust their words or madly claw through them.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: patience, patience-and-timing, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, test-of-patience, wait, waiting

quote: They went back to scooping up breakfast, licking the mess off their fingers. Soon the pile of berry mush was gone and their tongues were dyed a nice midnight blue. Ian seemed in a good mood, sticking his tongue out playfully at his best friend. Eena did likewise, right back at him. She was happy he was smiling, even if his teeth were purple. 	(You’re too much fun, Eena,) Ian announced in her mind. (I’m really glad we’re friends.)	(Me too,) she agreed. (Best friends.)	Ian leaned back on his hands and watched the waves roll in from far off. The swells were building into large, flat-crested waves. (Angelle never thought like you do. You’re creative and kinda crazy. Her thoughts were always more simple and, well…..normal.) 	(Yeah, well, deadly dragons and evil witches tend to suck all the normal right out of you,) she grumbled.	(I suppose.)
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Two Sisters
category: eena, ian, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-harrowbethian-saga

quote: But you will die, Amor
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Two Sisters
category: amora, eena, pallador, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-harrowbethian-saga

quote: How insane we are as humans when having received a nasty offense we return the same awful offense. If given an apple found to be rotten and wormy, would we not toss it aside rather than force a soul to eat it? Offenses should be discarded, not returned.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: offense, offenses, recompense, revenge, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, spite, vengeance, vindictiveness

quote: You are not my sunshine. Sorry. You're more like a gust of arctic wind that bursts in and blows out all the candles when the door cracks open.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: annoyance, arctic-wind, downer, fool, jerk, rascal, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, spoiler, sunshine

quote: Freedom is the atmosphere in which humanity thrives. Breathe it in.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: fourth-of-july, freedom, humanity, independence, independence-day, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Freedom is essential to the pursuit of happiness. Freedom is essential to artistic evolution and expression. Freedom is essential to the expansion of the human mind. Freedom is essential to the development and application of basic humanitarianism.Freedom is essential to the creation of an individual's will, motivations, preferences, and unique talents. In essence, freedom is essential to the success and progress of humanity.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: autonomy, birth, freedom, independence, independence-day, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, yearning

quote: What would it be like to live as a butterfly, being admired by the world for your color and beauty and grace? What would it be like to live as a spider, having people shriek and jump and throw a shoe at the very notice of you?I have tasted both―looks of desire and repulsion.How sad it is that we judge a life by such a trivial thing as appearance.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: appearance, appearances, biases, butterfly, judging, judging-others, reactions, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, spider

quote: Do we ignore the needyto spite the greedy?Or share and defenddespite those who pretend?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: charity, falsification, greedy, help, helping-hand, helping-others, needy, poor, pretend, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, share, sharing, spite

quote: Take time to laugh, to talk, to hug, and to cry. These are the human relief valves.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: cry, hug, human-emotions, laugh, laughter, relief-valves, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, talk

quote: If only you would kiss me.Press your lips to mine like a searing iron. Wrap me in your arms as if you were a monarch claiming a kingdom. Hold me close until I warm through to the core. Do this, and I promise to melt into you, no longer a cold and frozen figure in your narrowed sight. How devoted I would be if only your lips burned for mine!If only you would kiss me.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: devotion, kiss, kiss-me, longing, love, love-poem, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I like bubbles in everything. I respect the power of silence. In cold or warm weather I favor a mug of hot cocoa. I admire cats―their autonomy, grace, and mystery. I awe at the fiery colors in a sunset. I believe in deity. I hear most often with my eyes, and I will trust a facial expression before any accompanying comment. I invent rules, words, adventures, and imaginary friends. I pretend something wonderful every day. I will never quit pretending.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: about-me, i-like, likes, me, preferences, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The actual secret to success: Be a better friend today than you were yesterday.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: benefit, benevolence, devotion, friend, friendship, gain, happiness, love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, secret-to-success, success

quote: Despair is not for the living but for those unable to rise and continue; they are the only souls with a right to it. It is an end where breath and strength and will have vanished, leaving no way to persevere. To sink into the abyss that is despair is to suffer an existence far worse than death; therefore, cling to its enemy, our ally—hope. For life goes on, and we must not live in despair. We must not.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Two Sisters
category: angelle, derian, despair, eena, hope, hopelessness, ian, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-harrowbethian-saga

quote: You know the story.” The Nalnom rotated his hand in the air as if she should recall it.	“I don’t. I’ve never heard the story.”	Joshlon summarized it for her. “Prometheus was turned into a dragon by his angry lover, Naradite. She refused to turn him back into his manly form. He became the first fire-breathing dragon—Naga the Terrible.”	Eena dropped her lower jaw. “What?”	“Naradite turned Prometheus into a dragon,” Joshlon repeated. “Naga.”	“And Prometheus is Edgar’s father?” She was sure the surrounding stares were the result of her virtually shouting out the question.	Joshlon answered with some hesitance in his voice. “I don’t know who Edgar is, but Edgarmetheus was supposedly the son of Prometheus, the illegitimate child of him and his lover, Naradi
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Two Sisters
category: dragon, edgar, eena, joshlon, naga, nalnoms, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, the-harrowbethian-saga

quote: Tell me you didn’t,” she groaned, knowing it would not be the truth. “Please tell me you didn’t take advantage of these poor people.”	“I didn’t,” he chirped.	“Liar.”	With an irritated sigh he tried to convince her. “Amora, you’re not seeing things from an immortal perspective. The people who built this temple…”	“Temple?” she cried, cutting him off. “You forced these people to build you a temple? Why? Because all of a sudden you’re God now?”	Perturbed by her interruption, he raised a warning finger. “No, no, Amora, not God. But from their viewpoint I may seem a bit…..god-like.”	She rolled her eyes in an exaggerated manner.	“If you would let me finish,” he went on, “these particular individuals had no part in the construction of that monument; it was their ancestors who erected it. And I must say, they did a fine job. My likeness has weathered the centuries quite well.”	“You’re despicable.”	He frowned at the insult. “Nobody was forced to build us a temple, Amora. They chose to do so.”	“You were that impressive to them, huh?”	“Apparently.” His eyes twinkled at the memory. He took a few steps toward the distant city, pulling Eena along. “Come on, let’s go have some fun.”	“No way.” She planted her feet, refusing. Surprisingly it put a stop to him. 	“And why not?”	“Because your sudden appearance will upset them! No doubt you’ll want to show off with some shockingly grand entrance. I’m not going to take part in a game of deceit.”	“I’m not deceiving anyone,” Edgar disputed. “I can’t help it if they happen to think I’m perfectly magnificent.”	His pompous view of himself earned a nasty look as well as a lecture. “I can’t believe you’re okay with selling people lies that affect the way they live and think! You’re not even close to being a god, Edgar, and yet you allow them to accept you as some sort of deity because of your unusual abilities. For centuries now you’ve abandoned this world and a population who probably looked to you and your lousy sisters for help. It’s all a big, disgusting sham!”	Edgar pouted like a child. “Fine—spoil all my fun. We’ll go do something else. Something that doesn’t include your poor, fragile, stupid mortals.”	“They’re not stupid.”	“They think I’m a god,” he sn
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Two Sisters
category: amora, edgar, eena, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, series, the-harrowbethian-saga

quote: It is a sweet thing to have someone love you, but it is a far sweeter thing when his actions convince your heart, and his words persuade your soul.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: heart, husband, love, love-story, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, soul

quote: Enemies may unite to eliminate a common threat, but never without a wary eye fixed on their ally.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, The Tarishe Curse
category: allies, ally, duvalla, enemies, halloween, hallows-eve, kresh, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, tarishe-curse, threat, werewolves

quote: The sign of a good leader is easy to recognize, though it is hardly ever seen. For the greatest leaders are those who share as equals in the trials and struggles, the demands and expectations, the hills and trenches, the laws and punishments placed upon the backs of those governed. A great leader is motivated not by power but by compassion. Therefore he can do nothing but make himself a servant to those whom he rules. Such a leader is unequivocally respected, and loved for loving.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: authority, boss, captain, chief, command, control, direction, great-leaders, king, leaders, leadership, leadership-characteristics, manager, monarch, president, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, rule, ruler

quote: It's been a harsh fight.You've been pummeled and knocked down. Your body aches, flesh torn and bruised. Your eyes can hardly see through a stream of blood. But you are cognizant and alive; therefore, you rise from the fight.This is life. It will test your will, your strength, and endurance. It will challenge your faith and convictions. It will scar your hopes and try your beliefs. In the end, life validates those who refuse to stay down.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: approve, challenge, fight, life, life-lessons, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, test, try, validate

quote: The search only ends when you finally find the one who truly gets you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: gets-you, love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, search, the-one

quote: In my lifetime I have witnessed far too many miracles to believe in impossibilities, and so I am officially modifying the defini
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: definition, impossibility, impossible, miracles, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, unattainable

quote: Let the giggles fill your mouth because nothing tastes as sweet as laughter.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: giggles, happiness, laughter, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sound

quote: Life is a voyage across troubled waters where our days are often spent clinging to the top of the highest mast, scouting for a comforting glimpse of shore.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: crossing, life, life-quotes, passage, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, sailing, struggles, voyage, waters

quote: The sun shines every day without being told that it is brilliant. The mountains stand tall and majestic though no one informs them of their grandeur. The winds twirl and dance with clouds, minus cheers or compliments to inspire their moves. Flowers bloom, showing off colors, long before passing smiles acknowledge any beauty. The ocean claps at its own underwater chorus without topside ears listening. What is the world trying to tell you? Be wonderful because you are. Quit waiting to be told so first.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: be-happy, do-things, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, set-goals, wonderful

quote: If you couldn't sense heat, you'd not be alive. And if that heat never grew uncomfortable, you would never move. And if you were stagnant—unchallenged by unpredictable flares—you would never grow capable of shielding yourself from harsher flames. So yes, life was meant to drag you straight through the fire.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: challenges, confrontations, fire, heat, life, life-quotes, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, tests, trials

quote: Life is a bonfire where everyone else has brought marshmallows, and you—a stick.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: life, life-is-like, life-quotes, marshmallows, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: I love when the sun plays hide-n-seek for a few days because its invisibility often goes unnoticed. The world seems content that its presence behind the clouds is enough. But as soon as that brilliant sun jumps into the open sky once again―shining in full splendor―our closed eyes automatically turn toward it, and we bask beneath a warm and tender touch, grateful all the more that our glorious sun exists.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes

quote: It's mind-boggling how many different worlds people live in on this one planet.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: life, perspectives, planet, privilege, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, want, worlds

quote: Aging is a mortal term that my immortal spirit doesn't quite grasp.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: aging, getting-old, immortal, immortality, immortality-of-the-soul, mortal, mortality, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Powerlessness is an excruciating pain
author: it is torture insurmountable.

quote: You can't make me be nice.You can't make me be good.You can't make me be
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: example, force, growing-up, life, raising-children, richelle, richelle-goodrich, teaching

quote: Every now and then I sit and watch the sun rise to remind myself how it's done—peacefully, steadily, warmly, and in beautiful color.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: accomplishments, achieve, advance, move-ahead, perform, progress, richelle, richelle-goodrich, sunrise

quote: A kiss says it all—I like you.I love you.I need you.I want you.I value you.I fancy you.I adore you.I prefer you.I missed you.I cherish you.I support you.I care for you.I long for you.I think of you.I treasure you.I hope for you.I consider you.I dream of you.I delight in you.I appreciate you.And I will never, ever forget you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: kiss, kisses, kissing, love, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Laughter isn't a sign of insanity but a shield against it.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: humor, insanity, laugh, laugh-out-loud, laughter, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Christmas is a whisper of peace and a sigh of hope on the lips of love.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: christmas, holidays, hope, love, peace, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Eyes, so easily deceived, might judge more rightly with lids closed, allowing ears and heart to remain wide open."from "The Beauty of Ugh
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, I am not Frazzle!: And other stories for grown-ups
category: ears, eyes, heart, judge, judging-by-appearance, judging-people, richelle, richelle-goodrich, the-beauty-of-ugh, ugh

quote: Choose altruism, because selfishism is a lonely, cold, dark hole.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: altruism, benevolence, charity, generosity, giving, greed, helping, richelle, richelle-goodrich, selfish, selfishism, selfishness

quote: One bad turn does not excuse another.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: getting-even, retaliation, revenge, richelle, richelle-goodrich, unkindness, vengeance

quote: Physical attractiveness is no indicator of an individual's beauty."from "The Beauty of Ugh
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, I am not Frazzle!: And other stories for grown-ups
category: attractiveness, beauty, richelle, richelle-goodrich, the-beauty-of-ugh, ugh

quote: Live today facing forward—with your back on yesterday, your eyes on tomorrow, and your head and heart in the moment.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: forward, in-the-moment, life, live-life, richelle, richelle-goodrich, today, tomorrow, yesterday

quote: Face it; life's gonna chew you up and spit you out. If you're lucky you'll get stuck to the bottom of someone's shoe and be carried far, far away from it all.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: beating, defeat, hardships, harsh, life, richelle, richelle-goodrich, struggles, trials, troubles

quote: It's a waste of time worrying about something that worry won't fix. It's about as useful as trying to feed your pet rock.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: anxiety, anxiousness, concern, fret, richelle, richelle-goodrich, rock, worry, worrying, worrying-about-nothing, worrying-over-nothing

quote: You're not a tree. So move
author: make something happen.

quote: To wish for the happiest days is to wish for a season of sorrow; for it is only after prolonged, wintry darkness that the summer sun appears to shine at its brightest.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: happiness, joy, richelle, richelle-goodrich, sunshine, winter, wish

quote: Dare to forge your own path. Even rocks can roll.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: do, drive, excite, go, impel, move, richelle, richelle-goodrich, try

quote: A good dose of fantasy is exercise for your sensibilities
author: it keeps your avatar strong.

quote: Life isn't all perpetual bliss, nor is it one woeful weeping session. But you can concentrate so hard on noticing moments of one or the other that either a bright outlook or dim expectations becomes your regular illusion.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: bright, dim, expectations, illusion, life, noticing, outlook, outlook-in-life, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: If the world appears abundant in smiles or overwhelmed by scowls, you might ask yourself if you're not to blame.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: boomerang, cause, cause-and-effect, echo, reactions, rebound, reciprocate, responses, richelle, richelle-goodrich, smile

quote: How often it is that we set ourselves in the high seat, judging others, not having read their book but merely having glimpsed the cover.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: critical, criticism, gossip, judge, judging, judgmental, opinions, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: It's impossible to be involved in all situations, but there's no excuse not to be involved in something, somewhere, somehow, with someone. Make an ounce of difference.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: assist, care, change, charity, difference, give, help, involvement, matter, richelle, richelle-goodrich, volunteer, volunteerism

quote: You may think you've hit rock bottom in your life but guess what—there's more crud underneath those rocks.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: defeat, difficulties, disappointment, discouragement, life, misfortune, richelle, richelle-goodrich, setbacks, upset

quote: My knight may not wear a coat of shining armor, but his code of glowing honor will never fail to protect us both from evils far worse than any fire-breathing dragon.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: armor, champion, defend, dragon, evils, guard, honor, knight, knight-in-shining-armor, protect, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Life is a puzzle, a riddle, a test, a mystery, a game—whatever challenge you wish to compare it to. Just remember, you're not the only participant; no one person holds all the answers, the pieces, or the cards. The trick to success in this life is to accumulate teammates and not opponents.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: challenge, game-of-life, life, richelle, richelle-goodrich, surviving-life

quote: We always feel the brunt of the blow dealt to us, but hardly ever do we feel the impact we have on others. Why is that?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: blow, brunt, curiosities, effect, impact, irony, irony-of-life, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: I wonder at times if we're not all blind. It just seems there are an abundance of books unread, paint strokes not admired, and performances unattended. So much attention painstakingly sought and not given.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: attention, blindness, ignoring, richelle, richelle-goodrich, self-absorption

quote: There are many roads in this world that will guide you to pleasurable, fun, and exciting destinations that do not end in any form of lasting happiness. So before you step on an enticing path, figure out where it leads.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: enticement, excitement, fun, happiness, path, path-of-life, pleasure, richelle, richelle-goodrich, road, temptation, trail

quote: You baffle me, addle me, drive me insane. You muddle, befuddle, and rattle my brain. My senses are mad, Skewed judgment to blame.You drive me half stark-raving bonkers!(But the truly crazy thing is how I love it.)
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: addle, baffle, befuddle, bonkers, crazy, insane, mad, muddle, rattle, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Most people don't accept that they are an influence either improving or damaging others.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: affect, damage, example, improve, influence, richelle, richelle-goodrich, tear-down, uplift

quote: You matter.You are important.There is a reason for your existence.You may not see or understand how this is true, but truth doesn't cease to be truth because of doubt, blindness, or ignor
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: doubt, existence, importance, matter, mattering, reason-for-living, richelle, richelle-goodrich, significance

quote: Perfection is a paradigm meant to keep us striving and learning and growing. Like a wondrous sunset, perfection may be beyond our reach, but it is within our view and well worth seeking after.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: grow, learn, paradigm, perfection, progress, richelle, richelle-goodrich, seek, strive, sunset

quote: A real treasure becomes such only after it's been desperately sought after.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: possession, prize, richelle, richelle-goodrich, riches, seek, sought, treasure, valuables, work

quote: Trust in the silent doers. It is far more difficult to put your dreams into action than into flowery words.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: accomplishing, accomplishments, actions, actions-over-words, behavior, conduct, deeds, doing, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Time is an imp—a pesky, little, hellish troll that hastens the clock when I smile but then delays the passing of minutes when I frown.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: clock, delay, hasten, imp, minutes, passing-of-time, richelle, richelle-goodrich, time

quote: A little porch light from a distant farmhouse dimmed, feeling alone and unneeded until his smallest spark of illumination snuffed out entirely. The night fell as dark as it was quiet. Meanwhile, every secret eye within the vicinity―from insect to animal to human wanderer―stopped to blink, suddenly blinded. Their guiding light had vanished, extinguishing hope in the hearts of many. That little light had mattered, but he knew it not.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: consequence, hope, importance, importance-of-existence, matter, mattering, richelle, richelle-goodrich, significance

quote: Comparisons are like rigid fingers—eager to point at a subject but unwilling to grasp it.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: allegory, comparisons, example, irony, metaphor, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: The reality is that doing good unto others actually does more good for you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: doing-good, good-deeds, helping, richelle, richelle-goodrich, volunteering

quote: Compassion only plagues those with hearts, much like a field of thorns only troubles those who bleed.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Companionship of the Dragon's Soul
category: apathy, empathy, indifference, nonchalance, richelle, richelle-goodrich, sympathy, unconcern

quote: Happiness is seeing blessings in disguise, beauty under camouflage, and love amid conflict.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: beauty, blessings, contentment, happiness, joy, love, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Happiness isn't reserved for privileged individuals. It is a state of mind that can neither be bought nor stolen nor traded
author: it is a liberty available to anyone.

quote: Life may dawdle along in minutes but don't be deceived, for it will sprint by in years before you even notice.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: life, passing-days, passing-of-time, richelle, richelle-goodrich, time, years

quote: That was the coolest thing ever.” Eena smiled at the fact that she’d been lucky enough to touch the wings of a real crioness. 	“That was highly unusual. I can’t believe they came right up to us—to you.”	“They were hungry, I’m sure.”	“Still, crioness are cautious. They always avoid people. To let you touch him like it did…..”	She grinned with pure satisfaction. “Wild huh? Derian’s not going to believe me when I tell him.” Eena cocked her head when Ian laughed out loud. “What?” she asked, a note of offense in her
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Curse of Wanyaka Cave
category: crioness, derian, eena, ian, richelle, richelle-goodrich, the-harrowbethian-saga

quote: The watchful Mishmorat commented while waiting, contemplating Eena’s bare back. “Your people are so plain and pale.”“Oh?” Eena kinked her neck to look at Niki, zeroing in on her long spotted arms. Her bronze skin was arguably more striking—speckled in beautiful patterns.“I’m sorry,” the Mishmorat quickly apologized. “I didn’t mean to be rude. It’s just that I’ve never seen such bare skin before. There’s nothing to look at.”Eena quickly pulled the new t-shirt down over her back. She chuckled at Niki’s comment. “I’ll admit your people are very attractive. But I’m okay with my ‘plainness.’” She glanced over her pale legs before pulling on a clean pair of pants. “You’re kinda like a clear, cloudless sky,” Niki said, cocking her head wonderingly.“And you’re like a…..a sky dotted with shapely clouds.”“Only dark clouds.”“Storm clouds.”“Yeah,” Niki grinned devilishly, “That’s me—a sky full of storm clouds.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Curse of Wanyaka Cave
category: eena, mishmorat, niki, richelle, richelle-goodrich, the-harrowbethian-saga

quote: It may not be fair that people make judgments so quickly, usually within a few seconds of observation, but it's unrealistic to expect that they won't. So, if you want to be judged in a certain manner, be sure that your look and demeanor give that impression.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: demeanor, impressions, judging-others, judgments, look, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: The captain put his fingers to his temples as if he had a headache. “So, let me get this straight. Edgar, an immortal, who I assume is as unscrupulous as his sisters, tried to take that bracelet from you
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Curse of Wanyaka Cave
category: derian, dragons, eena, richelle, richelle-goodrich, the-harrowbethian-saga, zmey

quote: To punish someone for your own mistakes or for the consequences of your own actions, to harm another by shifting blame that is rightly yours; this is a wretched and cowardly sin.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: blame, censure, criticize, get-even, implicate, punishment, retribution, revenge, richelle, richelle-goodrich, slur, vengeance

quote: Boasting is one of those rare outfits that never looks good on you but makes you look stunning when modeled by your admirers.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway

quote: Just knowing you're not alone is often enough to kindle hope amid tragic circumstances.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway

quote: Kisses are a means to plant on another's lips a smile glossed with happiness.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: happiness, kiss, kisses, kissing, richelle, richelle-goodrich, smile

quote: When problems beat upon you like a raging storm, search for the eye. You might not be able to avoid misfortunes, but you can find the calmest spot within them.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: coping, difficulties, enduring, misfortunes, problems, richelle, richelle-goodrich, storms

quote: One thing I've learned is that in the midst of your darkest moments of tribulation, there is no such thing as mass friends.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: challenges, life-lessons, richelle, richelle-goodrich, trials, trials-of-life, tribulations, troubles

quote: Beauty that pleases the eye is a frail, fleeting illusion. But that beauty capable of pleasing the heart can endure endlessly.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway

quote: Hey, guard!” Ian hollered out loud. “Do you think we could get a bathroom break?”	The guard seemed to snicker as he pointed to the grass outside the cell. Eena smirked at how dead-on her thoughts had been after all.	“Come on,” Ian complained. “She can’t do that, she’s a girl.”	The soldier smiled wryly, a shrug communicating his indifference.	Eena laughed in her mind.	(I don’t know what you think’s so funny. You’re the one who’s gotta pee.)	Oddly enough, that fact just made her laugh even more.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Curse of Wanyaka Cave

quote: A snake bites your ankle.Recoiling, you scream.Fearing poison, your mind slips into a dream......where a man bites your ankle.Expecting no guile, 'Again' softly falls from your lips with a smile.Yet the man and the snake are the same.Your perception is only to blame.

quote: I laugh for sheer medicinal purposes
author: because I feel I might die otherwise.

quote: Happiness, thou art naught but an illusion. Thy enchantments are cast upon my eyes, my mind, my spellbound heart. Dependent upon nothing but thy victim's perception of thee, souls soar at thy artful hand! I have fallen in love with thy illusions, Happiness. Thou hast made me a part of them, and I am left delirious.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: happiness, illusion, outlook, perception, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: You can't argue with insanity. You can stare at it, gaping and incredulous, but arguing with it is futile.

quote: Dare to imagine. Dare to be. Books are the seeds. Dreams are the soil. The fruit of the harvest, a world reborn.

quote: This thing that troubles you is only one small part of your life. Don't allow it to be all-consuming when there's so much more to embrace.

quote: Though it pained me, I gave in. Why was it that I repeatedly succumbed to the first whisper of a promised maybe? How did the enticer, hope, always find my heart unguarded? There was no such thing as hope. Not for me. Why was it so hard to accept that?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Dandelions: The Disappearance of Annabelle Fancher

quote: Only a fool believes that his actions don't shape the world.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway

quote: Why is it that at the very moment I need to appear graceful I stumble and fall like a klutz, as though this scene had never played through my mind differently a million times?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: embarrassing, fool, preparedness, richelle, richelle-goodrich, wise

quote: The interruption did nothing but earn her a similar slap, as I’m sure she knew it would. Sometimes I wondered if my mother spoke up at the wrong time on purpose. As often as we endured my father’s abuse, she had to be aware that it wouldn’t save me from a beating but simply earn her one as well. Or was it that sharing my fate made her feel less guilt-ridden about those things that happened to me?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Dandelions: The Disappearance of Annabelle Fancher
category: abuse, annabelle, child-abuse, dandelions, fear, guilt, richelle, richelle-goodrich

author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Dandelions: The Disappearance of Annabelle Fancher

quote: I've a habit of placing a happy-face or a frowny-face on my calendar, depending on what kind of day I've had.  Often I slap a droopy circle in the box, discouraged by the things I failed to accomplish and the unpleasant encounters endured.  But then, invariably, a wise muse stops to ask me these three questio

quote: The sun, moon, and stars God gave to the world, but He embedded their glories in your countenance just for me. Woven in your hair are the sun's shimmering golden rays. From your face glows the pale luminescence of the moon. And in your eyes God sprinkled a million stars to twinkle against a backdrop of endless night. You are my celestial light.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: celestial, love, moon, richelle, richelle-goodrich, stars, sun

quote: There's enchantment in a smile, did you know?Shall I prove in a wink that it is so?Watch my mouth grin wide and see,How quick your lips smile back at me!
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: beaming, enchantment, grin, grinning, richelle, richelle-goodrich, smile

quote: He panted over me, winded by his own absurd lecture. The stench of his alcoholic breath stung my nose. Again I didn’t answer. I hoped he’d tire out and end his speech and hobble back to the living room without touching me. Such hopes were unlikely, as was the case this time. 	“Answer me, you good-for-nuthin’ wench!” 	The pain bit instantly as his hand connected with my cheek. I shook my head in answer to his crazy questions, feeling a rise of warm tears.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Dandelions: The Disappearance of Annabelle Fancher
category: abuse, alcoholism, annabelle, child-abuse, dandelions, fear, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Monsters excite us in this way or that.They make our pulse thrum and steal lives from the cat!They're frightening creatures, one peek and you'll see.Yet life without monsters, how dull it would be.Your tense, nervous laugh tells me you disagree?
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway

quote: And what about your brother, Agus? Will he be entertaining us with his pipes?”	“Ahgg,” Shanks rasped, wrinkling his nose. “I didn’t tell you? He ain’t with us no more.” A heavy fist slammed on the arm of the Viidun’s chair as he growled, “The idiot went off and got himself killed!” 	“What?” Derian and Eena replied in unison, both horrified by the news.	“You heard me,” Shanks bellowed. “The crazy fool should’ve known when to duck. He died in a bloody challenge with some brainless Deramptium! A downright disgraceful way to die! I’m ashamed to say he was my brother!”	“That’s a little harsh, isn’t it?” Eena muttered, mostly speaking to Derian.	“What was that?” the Viidun dem
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Return of a Queen

quote: When the girl didn’t move, Gavin summoned her near with his fingers. His heart thrummed as she obeyed, stepping up close to him. Her young stature was much shorter than his tall, wiry form. Gavin regarded her prettiness - pale cheeks, pink lips, inquisitive eyes. Fascinated by her, he longed to know her name.	“Who are you?” he asked. He heard the girl utter the same question at the same time.	Cocking his head, he claimed, “I asked you first.”	“No you didn’t,” she protested, shaking her red-hooded head, “I asked you at the same time you asked me.”	Gavin grinned at her insistence. It was hard for him not to chuckle. “Well, then, I suppose we’ll have to go with ‘girls first’.” His grin widened into a white smile.	The girl gestured to herself. “I’m Little Red Riding Hood.”	He recognized the name of a fairytale character, and groaned under his breath at not having discovered this dreamer’s real name.	“Actually,” she confessed almost immediately, “I’m not really Red Riding Hood. My name is Annabelle, but I’m pretending to be her because……well……because this is my dream and that’s what I wish to dream abo
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Secrets of a Noble Key Keeper
category: annabelle, dreamland, dreams, gavin, richelle, richelle-goodrich, secrets-of-a-noble-key-keeper

quote: Funny thing how when you reach out, people tend to reach right back. Best, then, to make sure your hand is open and not fisted.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway

quote: I shall ne'er chase rainbows again, Knowing no pot o' gold awaits at the end. My Irish treasure is not there. For ye, my love, abide with me here.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: irish, love, pot-of-gold, rainbow, richelle, richelle-goodrich, st-patrick-s-day, treasure

quote: Of course I want the moon. And were you to offer it, I'd propose as a trade the stars in my eyes.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: love, moon, richelle, richelle-goodrich, stars, sweet-talk

quote: Time and again the sun sets like a bedimming curtain before my eyes, taking with it all illumination, warmth, and color.  I am overwhelmed by night and the monsters that lurk in shadows of despair.  But alas, stars twinkle from afar, shedding the tiniest rays of lighted hope.  I am reminded that the sun also rises and that morning's glory shall restore beauty to my world.  The realization of this dream is only a matter of waiting out the dreary night.  So, I shall persevere.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: faith, hope, perseverance, richelle, richelle-goodrich, sunrise, sunset, trials

quote: Last night I danced. My body rose from its slump for the first time since the beginning of sorrows—my fingers beckoning to the stars at arm's length, back arching as tingles bubbled up my spine, hips caught in a silent tempo while on tiptoe I twirled in endless euphoric circles. It didn't matter that you loved me or that you didn't. For I was wanted by the gods last night, their seraphs and muses descending on moonbeams into my midst, caressing my face and gliding their spirited arms about my waist, lifting my toes from the soil that I might feel what it is to fly without heaviness of heart. I danced with them under the glow of a loyal moon. For one brief, visceral dance I joyed as Heaven joys—in endless bliss.And the universe cherished me.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: dance, inspirational-quote, joy, love, moon, moonbeams, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Yes, he knew he was falling in love, her way. And the worst part was, as disabling as he found the emotion to be he craved it all the more. To feel this way about a woman was amazing even if it was ‘temporary and fleeting’, as he’d put it. It was a natural high like he’d never felt before. One he couldn’t get enough of.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Return of a Queen
category: derian, eena, love, love-story, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: In an unfathomable expanse of universe supporting galaxies of star systems with orbiting planets innumerable, I am nothing.  And yet to the few bodies encircling my tiny little spot in the world, I am essential.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: importance, needed, purpose, richelle, richelle-goodrich, self-worth, worth

quote: Little girls grow up thinking that knights in shining armor actually exist.  But they don't.  And if those valiant heroes ever did bless this world with their chivalrous deeds, I imagine, just like Christ's apostles, they were destroyed by envy on the battlefront.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: expectations, heroes, knights, love, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: He reached out for her hand and she grabbed onto his. 	“Eena, when you’re ready to talk about it, I’ll be here. That’s what best friends are for.”	She let the tears fall. He’d never know they were for him. He’d think they were because of Derian. They held hands silently throughout the night, Ian unaware that this was by far her most tortured nightmare ever. Paradise so close, and yet completely unattainable.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Return of a Queen
category: eena, ian, nightmare, paradise, richelle, richelle-goodrich, sorrow

quote: When you do fall in love with me, Eena, I don’t want it to be because I gave into your demands, but because your heart gave into its desire to truly be loved.” With an injured frown he uttered goodnight and left the room.	She stood alone, chastised and bruised. It seemed right to apologize for her insensitive words, but not now. Not while a room full of people remained out there.

category: derian, eena, love, love-story, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Truly there are different kinds of pain.  But the most agonizing is the pain of regret, for which there is no lasting relief and no remedy.

quote: True love asks no question of the heart.  It knows with surety.

quote: Conundrum:  A fun word to repeat over and over again when no one's listening. Actual meaning is as puzzling as the need to chant the word.

quote: Wanting help, I reached out to serve. Seeking happiness, I smiled and offered comfort. Yearning for love, I showed love. And now I understand. My life was never about me, it was always about you.

quote: I’ll tell you what,” she said, prepared to make a deal. “Let’s see how your ‘diplomacy’ would profit us. If you can give me a decent solution to a pretend situation, I’ll agree to have you accompany me instead of Shanks. Although, I don’t know how wise it is to leave a Viidun captain on the Kemeniroc in your absence.”	Derian agreed to the test. “Okay, what’s your question?”	She thought hard for a moment; her eyes scrunching in concentration, lips pulled down to one side. Then, as a crooked grin spread across her lips, she set up an imagined scenario.	“Pretend we’re down on the planet with this King Wennergren when he graciously offers to walk us through his cherished garden. While we’re there he begs me to touch his favorite, award-winning flower, hoping my powers will make it thrive and blossom. But for some strange reason it doesn’t respond to me the way plants do on our world. Instead of thriving, the flower withers and dies right before his shocked and furious eyes. Now pretend he’s easily offended and has a horrible temper…”	Derian cut it. “You have no idea what his temperament is li
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Return of a Queen

quote: Eena!” 	Recognizing Ian’s voice, Eena turned to find him approaching her from behind. He was entirely clad in body armor and gauntlets, cradling an open-faced helmet in one arm. Painted on his chest plate was a flaming, gold sword. From his side hung a leather sheath, a golden hilt peeking from the top.	“I’m glad you’re back. You are going to stay and watch us play, aren’t you?” He looked hopeful she’d say yes.	Eena smiled brightly. “I didn’t know you were talented enough to be on a dueling team. Nice sword,” she t
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Return of a Queen

quote: Then what is true love?” she asked audaciously.	Derian leaned forward, his focus powerfully fixed on her. His voice turned delicate and compelling as he spoke. 	“Love is so much more than a feeling. True love, Eena, is something that develops over time. It’s not that initial infatuation nor the shivers and butterflies that take your breath away when you’re first attracted to someone. Those things are nice, but they are barely the beginning of what could become true love. The emotions you speak of are temporary and unreliable, elicited when two people come together. The power I speak of grows ever stronger over time until it is steadfast, even in separation. Then, reunited, it solidifies unshakably.”	She shook her head. “I don’t quite follow.” 	The captain inched closer, fixing her with the sincerest of gazes. His hands cupped as if he were holding his very heart within them. “True love is a developed and intense appreciation for someone. It’s that perfect awareness that you are finally whole when she’s with you, and that hollow incompleteness you suffer when she’s gone. True love takes time, Eena. It’s an earned comfort that tells you she’ll be right there beside you no matter what you do, not necessarily happy with your every action, but faithful to you just the same. Love is knowing someone so deeply, understanding her so completely, that you can finish her thoughts without hesitation, confident in reading her face, her body, even her slightest gesture means something to you. Love is years of devotion, sacrifice, commitment, loyalty, trust, faith, and friendship all wrapped up in one. True love does more than cause your heart to flutter, Eena. It upholds your heart when the infatuation no longer makes it flutter.”	“Wow.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Return of a Queen

quote: Christmas is like candy; it slowly melts in your mouth sweetening every taste bud, making you wish it could last forever.

quote: Love tickles parts of you that, prior to its influence, you didn't even know could feel.

quote: One thing about a skunk—once you recognize the markings, you know things are gonna stink.

quote: A new star, the Christ child, God's gift to mankind; these are what Christmas is made of.

quote: People love super heroes.  It's true we're  impressed by their bravery and fortitude, their supernatural gifts and physical brawn.  But the fact is, villains possess these same qualities.  So why our admiration for the hero and not the nemesis?  Because of virtue.   A super hero gives everything to defend what's good and right without seeking praise or reward.  Think about it.  All the great heroes give without taking, help without grumbling, sacrifice without asking recompense.  A super hero's real strength, what we absolutely fall in love with, is his finer virtue.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: helping-others, hero, richelle, richelle-goodrich, sacrifice, super-hero, villain, virtue

quote: What is the spirit of Christmas, you ask?  Let me give you the answer in a true story...On a cold day in December, feeling especially warm in my heart for no other reason than it was the holiday season, I walked through the store sporting a big grin on my face.  Though most people were far too busy going about their business to notice me, one elderly gentleman in a wheelchair brought his eyes up to meet mine as we neared each other traveling opposite directions.  He slowed in passing just long enough to speak to me."Now that's a Christmas smile if I ever saw one," he said.My lips stretched to their limit in response, and I thanked him for the compliment.  Then we went our separate ways. But, as I thought about the man and how sweetly he'd touched me, I realized something simply wonderful!  In that brief, passing interaction we'd exchanged heartfelt gifts!And that, my friend, is the spirit of Christ~mas.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: christmas, gifts, giving, holidays, richelle, richelle-goodrich, spirit-of-christmas

quote: It was God who gave a man's rib to a woman. But it is man who must learn to give away his heart and never take it back.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes

quote: Life is a love story, with every character yearning for permanent refuge in someone's heart.

quote: Happiness depends upon two things—pleasing God, and then pleasing yourself.

quote: It is terrifying,” said Adrian. “And weird, for lack of a better word. And part of you knows… well, part of you knows something’s not right. That your thinking’s not right. But what do you about that? All we can go on is what we think, how we see the world. If you can’t trust your own mind, what can you trust? What other people tell you?
author: Richelle Mead, The Golden Lily
category: adrian, bloodlines, golden, lily, mead, richelle, sydney

quote: Marriage is a million piece puzzle, a pristine and exciting pursuit at the beginning that gradually becomes a daunting task, usually more challenging than anticipated.   It is only those truly committed to solving that puzzle who witness in the end the miraculous outcome of every tiny piece laid out and pressed together in an inspiring and envious creation—a treasure only time, resoluteness, and perseverance could create.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: commitment, endurance, marriage, perserverance, resoluteness, reward, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: One of the most effective things you will ever do in life, whether you care to or not, is set an example.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: effect, example, exemplar, life, model, representative, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: When you open your mouth, listeners are offended.  When you close your mouth, the expectant are offended.  If a person seeks misdoing from you they will find it regardless of whether or not you deliver.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway

quote: Son, I hope your opinion of your mother hasn’t lessened, knowing what you now know.”	Gavin glanced up; incredulity skewed his eyebrows. His expression appeared both stunned and appalled. “Never, Father! I love her! It makes no difference to me where she came from.”	The man nodded, a show of relief in his features. His large hand, soft in touch, went to brush a string of hair away from his wife’s peaceful profile. “Your mother loves you too, son, more than anything in the world. She worries about you, day and night.”	That sentiment stirred something profoundly pleasant inside the boy. He grinned at the internal warmth it created.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Secrets of a Noble Key Keeper
category: devotion, gavin, love, mother, richelle, richelle-goodrich, secrets

quote: There are no unsacred places
author: there are only sacred places and desecrated places.

quote: If anything is sacred, the human body is sacred.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: There is nothing so secular that it cannot be sacred, and that is one of the deepest messages of the Incarnation.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: There must be something strangely sacred in salt. It is in our tears and in the sea.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: In this moment, everything is sacred.
author: Ariel Books

quote: I felt somewhat like a fire hydrant – with everyone marking their territory around me.
author: Farrah Naseem

quote: I guess I haven’t mentioned it before but I was, I am and I think I might always remain in love with you,” he said with such passion that I froze in surprise. He went on. “And just so you know, I am prepared to fight for you, regardless of whether or not you share my sentiments.
author: Farrah Naseem

quote: There is no less holiness at this time- as you are reading this- than there was on the day the Red Sea parted, or that day in the 30th year, in the 4th month, on the 5th day of the month as Ezekiel was a captive by the river Cheban, when the heavens opened and he saw visions of god. There is no whit less enlightenment under the tree at the end of your street than there was under Buddha’s bo tree…. In any instant the sacred may wipe you with its finger. In any instant the bush may flare, your feet may rise, or you may see a bunch of souls in trees.
author: Annie Dillard, For the Time Being

quote: I have fallen in love with you Sasha Ava Stryker. I am afraid it is eternal and binding. I wanted to stake my claim on you tonight. To make you mine – for now and infinity to come.
author: Farrah Naseem
category: ariston-kavanagh, claim, eternal, farrah-naseem, infinity, love, sacred

quote: Jesus of Nazareth is so entirely one of them they can hardly find anything special about him at all. He fits right in with the messy busyness of everyday life. And it is here, in their midst, with their routines of fish and wine and bread, that he proclaims the kingdom of heaven. The gospel, Jesus teaches, is in the yeast, as a woman kneads it with her bare hands into the cool, pungent dough. It is in the soil, so warm and moist when freshly turned by muscular arms and backs.
